A double ring-shaped homohexamer of hslV is capped on each side by a ring-shaped hslU homohexamer
Belongs to the peptidase T1B family. HslV subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the heat shock protein 90 family

comment.text: Belongs to the peptidase M48B family

comment.text: Contains an active site 4-methylidene-imidazole-5-one (MIO), which is formed autocatalytically by cyclization and dehydration of residues Ala-Ser-Gly

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: No specific function has so far been attributed to this initiation factor; however, it seems to stimulate more or less all the activities of the other two initiation factors, IF-2 and IF-3

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the essential components for the initiation of protein synthesis. Protects formylmethionyl-tRNA from spontaneous hydrolysis and promotes its binding to the 30S ribosomal subunits. Also involved in the hydrolysis of GTP during the formation of the 70S ribosomal complex

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: IF-3 binds to the 30S ribosomal subunit and shifts the equilibrum between 70S ribosomes and their 50S and 30S subunits in favor of the free subunits, thus enhancing the availability of 30S subunits on which protein synthesis initiation begins

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein is one of the two subunits of integration host factor, a specific DNA-binding protein that functions in genetic recombination as well as in transcriptional and translational control
Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta chain
Belongs to the bacterial histone-like protein family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein is one of the two subunits of integration host factor, a specific DNA-binding protein that functions in genetic recombination as well as in transcriptional and translational control
Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta chain
Belongs to the bacterial histone-like protein family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-isoleucine biosynthesis; L-isoleucine from 2-oxobutanoate: step 2
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-valine biosynthesis; L-valine from pyruvate: step 2
Belongs to the ketol-acid reductoisomerase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-isoleucine biosynthesis; L-isoleucine from 2-oxobutanoate: step 3
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-valine biosynthesis; L-valine from pyruvate: step 3

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds 4 magnesium ions per subunit. Other metal ions can support activity, but at a lower rate. Two magnesium ions are required for the activation of the enzyme and are present before substrate binds, two additional magnesium ions form complexes with substrate and product

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the formation of 4-diphosphocytidyl-2-C-methyl-D-erythritol from CTP and 2-C-methyl-D-erythritol 4-phosphate (MEP)
Isoprenoid biosynthesis; isopentenyl-PP biosynthesis via DXP pathway; isopentenyl-PP from 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate: step 2

feature.description: Positions MEP for the nucleophilic attack
Positions MEP for the nucleophilic attack

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of the position 2 hydroxy group of 4-diphosphocytidyl-2C-methyl-D-erythritol
Isoprenoid biosynthesis; isopentenyl-PP biosynthesis via DXP pathway; isopentenyl-PP from 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate: step 3
Belongs to the GHMP kinase family. IspE subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds 1 divalent metal cation per subunit
Isoprenoid biosynthesis; isopentenyl-PP biosynthesis via DXP pathway; isopentenyl-PP from 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate: step 4

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Isoprenoid biosynthesis; isopentenyl-PP biosynthesis via DXP pathway; isopentenyl-PP from 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate: step 5

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Converts 1-hydroxy-2-methyl-2-(E)-butenyl 4-diphosphate into isopentenyl diphosphate (IPP) and dimethylallyl diphosphate (DMAPP)
Isopentenyl diphosphate + NAD(P)(+) + H(2)O = (E)-4-hydroxy-3-methylbut-2-en-1-yl diphosphate + NAD(P)H
Isoprenoid biosynthesis; dimethylallyl-PP biosynthesis; dimethylallyl-PP from 1-hydroxy-2-methyl-2-butenyl 4-diphosphate: single step [final step]
Isoprenoid biosynthesis; isopentenyl-PP biosynthesis via DXP pathway; isopentenyl-PP from 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate: step 6 [final step]

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in cell division; probably involved in intracellular septation

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This small ubiquitous enzyme is essential for maintenance and cell growth
Belongs to the adenylate kinase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the cytidylate kinase family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Activates KDO (a required 8-carbon sugar) for incorporation into bacterial lipopolysaccharide in Gram-negative bacteria

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Essential for recycling GMP and indirectly, cGMP
Belongs to the guanylate kinase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Metabolic intermediate biosynthesis; 5-phospho-alpha-D-ribose 1-diphosphate biosynthesis; 5-phospho-alpha-D-ribose 1-diphosphate from D-ribose 5-phosphate (I): single step [final step]
Belongs to the ribose-phosphate pyrophosphokinase family

protein.name: Dimethyladenosine transferase
S-adenosylmethionine-6-N', N'-adenosyl(rRNA) dimethyltransferase
16S rRNA dimethylase
High level kasugamycin resistance protein ksgA
Kasugamycin dimethyltransferase

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Specifically dimethylates two adjacent adenosines in the loop of a conserved hairpin near the 3'end of 16S rRNA in the 30S particle. Its inactivation leads to kasugamycin resistance
Belongs to the rRNA adenine N-6-methyltransferase family. KsgA subfamily

protein.name: Probable potassium transport system protein kup

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Transport of potassium into the cell
Belongs to the HAK/KUP transporter (TC 2.A.72) family

feature.description: Probable potassium transport system protein kup

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the GTP-binding elongation factor family. LepA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the condensation of the acetyl group of acetyl-CoA with 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate (2-oxoisovalerate) to form 3-carboxy-3-hydroxy-4-methylpentanoate (2-isopropylmalate)
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-leucine biosynthesis; L-leucine from 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate: step 1
Belongs to the alpha-IPM synthetase/homocitrate synthase family. LeuA type 2 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the isomerization between 2-isopropylmalate and 3-isopropylmalate, via the formation of 2-isopropylmaleate
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-leucine biosynthesis; L-leucine from 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate: step 2
Belongs to the aconitase/IPM isomerase family. LeuC type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the oxidation of 3-carboxy-2-hydroxy-4-methylpentanoate (3-isopropylmalate) to 3-carboxy-4-methyl-2-oxopentanoate. The product decarboxylates to 4-methyl-2 oxopentanoate
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-leucine biosynthesis; L-leucine from 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate: step 3
Belongs to the isocitrate and isopropylmalate dehydrogenases family. LeuB type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the isomerization between 2-isopropylmalate and 3-isopropylmalate, via the formation of 2-isopropylmaleate
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-leucine biosynthesis; L-leucine from 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate: step 2
Belongs to the leuD family. LeuD type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Represses a number of genes involved in the response to DNA damage (SOS response), including recA and lexA. In the presence of single-stranded DNA, recA interacts with lexA causing an autocatalytic cleavage which disrupts the DNA-binding part of lexA, leading to derepression of the SOS regulon and eventually DNA repair
Hydrolysis of Ala-|-Gly bond in repressor lexA
Belongs to the peptidase S24 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Represses a number of genes involved in the response to DNA damage (SOS response), including recA and lexA. In the presence of single-stranded DNA, recA interacts with lexA causing an autocatalytic cleavage which disrupts the DNA-binding part of lexA, leading to derepression of the SOS regulon and eventually DNA repair
Hydrolysis of Ala-|-Gly bond in repressor lexA
Belongs to the peptidase S24 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Functions in the N-end rule pathway of protein degradation where it conjugates Leu, Phe and, less efficiently, Met from aminoacyl-tRNAs to the N-termini of proteins containing an N-terminal arginine or lysine

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Transfers the N-acyl diglyceride group on what will become the N-terminal cysteine of membrane lipoproteins

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the radical-mediated insertion of two sulfur atoms into an octanoyl group bound to acyl carrier protein (ACP) to produce a lipoyl group
Binds 1 4Fe-4S cluster coordinated with 3 cysteines and an exchangeable S-adenosyl-L-methionine
Belongs to the biotin and lipoic acid synthetases family. LipA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the transfer of the endogenously synthesized lipoate to apoproteins, creating an amide linkage that joins the free carboxyl group of lipoic acid to the epsilon-amino group of a specific lysine residue in lipoate-dependent enzymes. Utilizes lipoyl-acyl-carrier protein as a source of lipoyl groups, although octanoyl groups from octanoyl-ACP can also be transferred to the lipoyl domain of apoproteins
lipoyl-[acyl-carrier protein] + apo-protein = holo-protein + acyl-carrier protein

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the FMN-dependent alpha-hydroxy acid dehydrogenase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Transfers the fatty acyl group on membrane lipoproteins
Belongs to the CN hydrolase family. Apolipoprotein N-acyltransferase subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Participates in the translocation of lipoproteins from the inner membrane to the outer membrane. Only forms a complex with a lipoprotein if the residue after the N-terminal Cys is not an aspartate (The Asp acts as a targeting signal to indicate that the lipoprotein should stay in the inner membrane)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Plays a critical role in the incorporation of lipoproteins in the outer membrane after they are released by the lolA protein
Attached to the outer membrane by a lipid anchor

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex lolCDE involved in the translocation of mature outer membrane-directed lipoproteins, from the inner membrane to the periplasmic chaperone, lolA. Responsible for the formation of the lolA-lipoprotein complex in an ATP-dependent manner
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (lolD) and two transmembrane proteins (lolC and lolE)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Lipoprotein translocase (TC 3.A.1.125) subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A, a phosphorylated glycolipid that anchors the lipopolysaccharide to the outer membrane of the cell
Belongs to the transferase hexapeptide repeat family. LpxA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Condensation of UDP-2,3-diacylglucosamine and 2,3-diacylglucosamine-1-phosphate to form lipid A disaccharide, a precursor of lipid A, a phosphorylated glycolipid that anchors the lipopolysaccharide to the outer membrane of the cell

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A, a phosphorylated glycolipid that anchors the lipopolysaccharide to the outer membrane of the cell

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the transferase hexapeptide repeat family. LpxD subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the hydrolysis of the pyrophosphate bond of UDP-2,3-diacylglucosamine to yield 2,3-diacylglucosamine 1-phosphate (lipid X) and UMP

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Transfers the gamma-phosphate of ATP to the 4'-position of a tetraacyldisaccharide 1-phosphate intermediate (termed DS-1-P) to form tetraacyldisaccharide 1,4'-bis-phosphate (lipid IVA)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein specifically catalyzes the removal of signal peptides from prolipoproteins

Release of signal peptides from bacterial membrane prolipoproteins. Hydrolyzes -Xaa-Yaa-Zaa-|-(S,diacylglyceryl)Cys-, in which Xaa is hydrophobic (preferably Leu), and Yaa (Ala or Ser) and Zaa (Gly or Ala) have small, neutral side chains
Belongs to the peptidase A8 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the malate synthase family. GlcB subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the reversible oxidation of malate to oxaloacetate
Belongs to the LDH/MDH superfamily. MDH type 3 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the formation of S-adenosylmethionine from methionine and ATP. The overall synthetic reaction is composed of two sequential steps, AdoMet formation and the subsequent tripolyphosphate hydrolysis which occurs prior to release of AdoMet from the enzyme
ATP + L-methionine + H(2)O = phosphate + diphosphate + S-adenosyl-L-methionine
Binds 2 divalent ions, such as magnesium or cobalt, per subunit
Belongs to the AdoMet synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-methionine biosynthesis; O-acetyl-L-homoserine from L-homoserine: single step
Belongs to the AB hydrolase superfamily. HTA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the first step in the biosynthesis of 2-methylthio-N6-(delta(2)-isopentenyl)-adenosine (MS[2]I[6]A) adjacent to the anticodon of several tRNA species
Isopentenyl diphosphate + tRNA = diphosphate + tRNA containing 6-isopentenyladenosine
Belongs to the IPP transferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cell division inhibitor that blocks the formation of polar Z ring septums. Rapidly oscillates between the poles of the cell to destabilize ftsZ filaments that have formed before they mature into polar Z rings. Prevent ftsZ polymerization

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Prevents the cell division inhibition by proteins minC and minD at internal division sites while permitting inhibition at polar sites. This ensures cell division at the proper site by restricting the formation of a division septum at the midpoint of the long axis of the cell

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Together with moaC, is involved in the conversion of a guanosine derivative (5'-GTP) into molybdopterin precursor Z

Binds 2 4Fe-4S clusters. Binds 1 4Fe-4S cluster coordinated with 3 cysteines and an exchangeable S-adenosyl-L-methionine and 1 4Fe-4S cluster coordinated with 3 cysteines and the GTP-derived substrate
Belongs to the radical SAM superfamily. MoaA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Together with moaA, is involved in the conversion of a guanosine derivative (5'-GTP) into molybdopterin precursor Z

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Links a guanosine 5'-phosphate to molydopterin (MPT) forming molybdopterin guanine dinucleotide (MGD)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex modABC involved in molybdenum import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + molybdate(Out) = ADP + phosphate + molybdate(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (modC), two transmembrane proteins (modB) and a solute-binding protein (modA)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Molybdate importer (TC 3.A.1.8) subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: First step of the lipid cycle reactions in the biosynthesis of the cell wall peptidoglycan
Belongs to the glycosyltransferase 4 family. MraY subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

protein.name: Lipid A export ATP-binding/permease protein msbA

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in lipid A export and possibly also in glycerophospholipid export and for biogenesis of the outer membrane. Transmembrane domains (TMD) form a pore in the inner membrane and the ATP-binding domain (NBD) is responsible for energy generation
In msbA the ATP-binding domain (NBD) and the transmembrane domain (TMD) are fused
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Lipid exporter (TC 3.A.1.106) subfamily

feature.description: Lipid A export ATP-binding/permease protein msbA

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Channel that opens in response to stretch forces in the membrane lipid bilayer. May participate in the regulation of osmotic pressure changes within the cell

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Has an important function as a repair enzyme for proteins that have been inactivated by oxidation. Catalyzes the reversible oxidation-reduction of methionine sulfoxide in proteins to methionine
Protein L-methionine + thioredoxin disulfide = protein L-methionine S-oxide + thioredoxin
Belongs to the msrA Met sulfoxide reductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Protein L-methionine + thioredoxin disulfide = protein L-methionine S-oxide + thioredoxin
Belongs to the msrB Met sulfoxide reductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Could be involved in the modification of 2'-hydroxyl groups of ribose in a RNA molecule
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. RrmJ family. MtfA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the isomerization of methylthioribose-1-phosphate into methylthioribulose-1-phosphate
Methionine salvage; phosphorylase pathway; second step
Belongs to the EIF-2B alpha/beta/delta subunits family. MtnA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cell wall formation. Adds enolpyruvyl to UDP-N-acetylglucosamine
Belongs to the EPSP synthase family. MurA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + UDP-N-acetylmuramate + L-alanine = ADP + phosphate + UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-L-alanine

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cell wall formation. Catalyzes the addition of glutamate to the nucleotide precursor UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-L-alanine (UMA)
ATP + UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-L-alanine + glutamate = ADP + phosphate + UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-L-alanyl-D-glutamate

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cell wall formation. Diaminopimelic acid adding enzyme

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cell wall formation. Catalyzes the transfer of a GlcNAc subunit on undecaprenyl-pyrophosphoryl-MurNAc-pentapeptide (lipid intermediate I) to form undecaprenyl-pyrophosphoryl-MurNAc-(pentapeptide)GlcNAc (lipid intermediate II)
Belongs to the glycosyltransferase 28 family. MurG subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Provides the (R)-glutamic acid required for cell wall biosynthesis
Belongs to the aspartate/glutamate racemases family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein is involved in the repair of mismatches in DNA. It is required for dam-dependent methyl-directed DNA mismatch repair. May act as a "molecular matchmaker", a protein that promotes the formation of a stable complex between two or more DNA-binding proteins in an ATP-dependent manner without itself being part of a final effector complex
Belongs to the DNA mismatch repair mutL/hexB family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein is involved in the repair of mismatches in DNA. It is possible that it carries out the mismatch recognition step. This protein has a weak ATPase activity
Belongs to the DNA mismatch repair mutS family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the reversible adenylation of nicotinate mononucleotide (NaMN) to nicotinic acid adenine dinucleotide (NaAD)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + deamido-NAD(+) + NH(3) = AMP + diphosphate + NAD(+)
Belongs to the NAD synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Major role in the synthesis of nucleoside triphosphates other than ATP. The ATP gamma phosphate is transferred to the NDP beta phosphate via a ping-pong mechanism, using a phosphorylated active-site intermediate
ATP + nucleoside diphosphate = ADP + nucleoside triphosphate

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Seems to be associated with the nucleoid

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex nikABCDE involved in nickel import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + Ni(2+)(Out) = ADP + phosphate + Ni(2+)(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (nikD and nikE), two transmembrane proteins (nikB and nikC) and a solute-binding protein (nikA)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Nickel importer (TC 3.A.1.5.3) subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex nikABCDE involved in nickel import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + Ni(2+)(Out) = ADP + phosphate + Ni(2+)(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (nikD and nikE), two transmembrane proteins (nikB and nikC) and a solute-binding protein (nikA)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Nickel importer (TC 3.A.1.5.3) subfamily

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the transcriptional regulatory copG/nikR family

comment.text: Modulates the activities of several enzymes which are inactive in their acetylated form
NAD(+) + an acetylprotein = nicotinamide + O-acetyl-ADP-ribose + a protein

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the Nudix hydrolase family. NudH subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: NDH-1 shuttles electrons from NADH, via FMN and iron-sulfur (Fe-S) centers, to quinones in the respiratory chain. The immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme in this species is believed to be ubiquinone. Couples the redox reaction to proton translocation (for every two electrons transferred, four hydrogen ions are translocated across the cytoplasmic membrane), and thus conserves the redox energy in a proton gradient
Composed of 13 different subunits. Subunits nuoCD, E, F, and G constitute the peripheral sector of the complex
Belongs to the complex I 75 kDa subunit family

protein.name: N utilization substance protein B homolog
Protein nusB

comment.text: Involved in the transcription termination process

comment.text: Involved in the biosynthesis of osmoregulated periplasmic glucans (OPGs)

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-arginine biosynthesis; L-arginine from L-ornithine and carbamoyl phosphate: step 1

comment.text: Required for the insertion of integral membrane proteins into the membrane. Probably plays an essential role in the integration of proteins of the respiratory chain complexes. Involved in integration of membrane proteins that insert dependently and independently of the Sec translocase complex
Specifically interacts with transmembrane segments of nascent integral membrane proteins during membrane integration
Belongs to the OXA1/oxaA family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Very strongly associated with the peptidoglycan
Attached to the outer membrane by a lipid anchor
Belongs to the ompA family. Pal subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cofactor biosynthesis; pantothenate biosynthesis; pantoate from 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate: step 1

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cofactor biosynthesis; pantothenate biosynthesis; pantothenate from beta-alanine and pantoate: single step [final step]
Belongs to the pantothenate synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in chromosome partition. Localize to both poles of the predivisional cell following completion of DNA replication. Binds to the DNA origin of replication

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catabolism of catechol to succinate and acetyl-CoA in the beta-ketoadipate pathway; penultimate step
Belongs to the 3-oxoacid CoA-transferase subunit B family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the NAD-dependent oxidation of 4-(phosphohydroxy)-L-threonine (HTP) into 2-amino-3-oxo-4-(phosphohydroxy)butyric acid which spontaneously decarboxylate to form 1-amino-3-(phosphohydroxy)propan-2-one (3-amino-2-oxopropyl phosphate)
De novo synthesis of pyridoxine (vitamin B6) and pyridoxal phosphate

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: De novo synthesis of pyridoxine (vitamin B6) and pyridoxal phosphate; pdxA branch; second step
Belongs to the D-isomer specific 2-hydroxyacid dehydrogenase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Oxidizes PNP and PMP into pyridoxal 5'-phosphate (PLP)
Pyridoxamine 5'-phosphate + H(2)O + O(2) = pyridoxal 5'-phosphate + NH(3) + H(2)O(2)
De novo synthesis of pyridoxine (vitamin B6) and pyridoxal phosphate
Belongs to the pyridoxamine 5'-phosphate oxidase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the condensation of 1-deoxy-D-xylulose-5-phosphate (DXP) and 1-amino-3-(phosphohydroxy)propan-2-one to form pyridoxine 5'-phosphate (PNP)
De novo synthesis of pyridoxine (vitamin B6) and pyridoxal phosphate

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; pyruvate from D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate: step 2
Belongs to the phosphoglycerate kinase family

citation.name: J. Biol. Chem.
citation.title: A new metabolic link between fatty acid de novo synthesis and polyhydroxyalkanoic acid synthesis. The phaG gene from Pseudomonas putida KT2440 encodes a 3-hydroxyacyl-acyl carrier protein-coenzyme A transferase.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the transfer of the acyl moiety from in vitro synthesized 3-hydroxydecanoyl-CoA to acyl carrier protein
Directly links the fatty acid de novo biosynthesis and polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA) biosynthesis

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex phnCDE involved in phosphonates import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + phosphonate(Out) = ADP + phosphate + phosphonate(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (phnC), two transmembrane proteins (phnE) and a solute-binding protein (phnD)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Phosphonates importer (TC 3.A.1.9.1) subfamily
